member.name: T:Tobii.EyeX.Client.InteractionObject
member.summary: Common base class for interaction object wrappers. The default behavior of interaction object wrapper is to get an unmanaged handle during construction and to release it during finalization. Interaction object wrappers are completely stateless. All states are kept by the underlying native interaction object to which a wrapper only has a handle.

member.summary: Abstract base class for wrappers of native handles.

members.member: A wrapper around an interaction context. >

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new interaction context.
member.param: Specifies if objects for owned by this context should be tracked. Specifying true will give more information on leaking objects when shutting down but comes with a performance hit and is not recommended for production builds.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.GetTrackedObjects
member.summary: Gets all the tracked s. Requires the context to be set up to track objects. This method is mainly for debugging purposes in case an application has issues with leaking s.
member.returns: A collection of tracked s or an empty collection if object tracking is not enabled.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.EnableConnection
member.summary: Enables the connection to the server. This method must be called to start the communication between the client and server. Once the connection has been enabled the client will attempt to always keep it alive. If the connection to the server for some reason goes down, the client will immediately attemt to reconnect. No communication can be performed before the connection has been enabled. The state of the connection can be retrieved using . The event will be raised when the connection state changes.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.DisableConnection
member.summary: Disables the connection to the server. The connection may be re-enabled using .

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.RegisterMessageHandler(Tobii.EyeX.Framework.MessageType,Tobii.EyeX.Client.MessageHandler)
member.summary: Registers a message handler to be invoked when a message of a specific type arrives.
member.param: The for which to invoke the specified message handler.
The message handler to be invoked when a message of the specified arrives.
member.returns: A ticket used to track this particular subscription. Should be used when unregistering the message handler.
member.exception: Will be thrown with result if messageHandler is null.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.RegisterMessageHandler(Tobii.EyeX.Framework.MessageType,Tobii.EyeX.Client.MessageHandler,Tobii.EyeX.Client.PropertyBag)
member.summary: Registers a message handler to be invoked when a message of a specific type arrives.
member.param: The for which to invoke the specified message handler.

Options for the registration.
member.returns: A ticket used to track this particular subscription. Should be used when unregistering the message handler.
member.exception: Will be thrown with result if messageHandler is null.

member.summary: Unregisters a message handler.
member.param: The ticket that was retrieved upon subscription.
member.exception: Will be thrown with the ticket does not represent a subscription.

The query handler to be invoked when a query arrives.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.EnableBuiltinKeys(System.IntPtr,Tobii.EyeX.Client.AsyncDataHandler)
member.summary: Enables EyeX builtin keys for a top-level window where the keys was previously disabled.
member.param: The window id for which to re-enable keys (window id corresponds to the windows handle on Windows).
The completion handler invoked when the response from the server arrives. Can be null.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.DisableBuiltinKeys(System.IntPtr,Tobii.EyeX.Client.AsyncDataHandler)
member.summary: Disables EyeX builtin keys for a top-level window. When the gaze is over the specified window, all interaction must be done through action commands.
member.param: The window id for which to disable keys (window id corresponds to the windows handle on Windows).
The completion handler invoked when the response from the server arrives. Can be null.
member.exception: Will be thrown on errors.

member.exception: Will be thrown on errors.

The data for the state.
The completion handler invoked when the response from the server arrives.
member.exception: Will be thrown with result if completionHandler is null or statePath is null or empty.

member.summary: Registers a state changed handler for state changes.

member.summary: Registers a state path for observation. When a state that matches the specified path is changed a will be sent from the server.
member.param: The path to observe.
member.exception: Will be thrown with result if statePath is null or empty.

member.summary: Unregisters a state path from observation.

member.summary: Gets a state asynchronously.
member.param: The path of the state to get.
A completion handler which will be invoked when the result arrives from the server.
member.exception: Will be thrown with result if completionHandler is null or statePath is null or empty.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.GetState(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a state. This method will block until the result has arrived from the server.
member.param: The path of the state to get.
member.returns: A containing the requested state or null of not found.
member.exception: Will be thrown with result if statePath is null or empty.

member.name: M:Tobii.EyeX.Client.Context.Shutdown(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shuts down the context. Closes the connection and blocks until all internal operations has finished. If any is still alive when the internal threads has been joined the shutdown process will wait for the specified cleanupTimeout time.
member.param: The amount of time to wait for all s to be released.
